# @f0rbit/ui v0.1.8

> A minimal, composable UI component library for SolidJS

## Installation

```bash
bun add @f0rbit/ui
# or
npm install @f0rbit/ui
```

## Setup

```tsx
// Import styles in your app entry
import "@f0rbit/ui/styles.css";

// Import components
import { Button, Card, Modal } from "@f0rbit/ui";
```

## Components

### Badge
A small label for categorization or status indication

**Exports:** Badge

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Badge } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Badge>Default</Badge>
<Badge variant="success">Active</Badge>
```

```tsx
<Badge>Default</Badge>
<Badge variant="success">Success</Badge>
<Badge variant="error">Error</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Warning</Badge>
<Badge variant="info">Info</Badge>
<Badge variant="accent">Accent</Badge>
```

```tsx
<Badge variant="success">
  <span>‚úì</span> Completed
</Badge>
<Badge variant="error">
  <span>‚úï</span> Failed
</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">
  <span>‚ö†</span> Warning
</Badge>
```

```tsx
<Badge variant="success">Online</Badge>
<Badge variant="error">Offline</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Away</Badge>
```

```tsx
<Badge>New</Badge>
<Badge variant="accent">Featured</Badge>
<Badge variant="info">Beta</Badge>
```

```tsx
<Badge>3 items</Badge>
<Badge variant="error">5 errors</Badge>
```

---

### Button
A clickable button with multiple variants and sizes

**Exports:** Button

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Button } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Button variant="primary">Click me</Button>
```

```tsx
<Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
<Button variant="danger">Danger</Button>
```

```tsx
<Button size="sm">Small</Button>
<Button size="md">Medium</Button>
<Button size="lg">Large</Button>
```

```tsx
<Button loading>Saving...</Button>
```

```tsx
<Button disabled>Not available</Button>
```

```tsx
<Button icon label="Add item">
  <PlusIcon />
</Button>
```

```tsx
<Button icon label="Add"><PlusIcon /></Button>
<Button icon label="Edit" variant="secondary"><EditIcon /></Button>
<Button icon label="Settings" variant="ghost"><SettingsIcon /></Button>
<Button icon label="Delete" variant="danger"><TrashIcon /></Button>
```

```tsx
<Button icon label="Small" size="sm"><PlusIcon /></Button>
<Button icon label="Loading" loading><PlusIcon /></Button>
<Button icon label="Disabled" disabled><PlusIcon /></Button>
```

---

### Card
A container component for grouping related content

**Exports:** Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Card Title</CardTitle>
    <CardDescription>Card description text</CardDescription>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>
    Main content goes here
  </CardContent>
  <CardFooter>
    Footer content
  </CardFooter>
</Card>
```

```tsx
<Card interactive onClick={() => handleClick()}>
  <CardContent>
    Click me!
  </CardContent>
</Card>
```

```tsx
<Card>
  <CardContent>
    <p>A simple card with just content.</p>
  </CardContent>
</Card>
```

```tsx
<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Confirm Action</CardTitle>
    <CardDescription>Are you sure you want to proceed?</CardDescription>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>
    <p>This action will update your settings.</p>
  </CardContent>
  <CardFooter>
    <Button variant="secondary">Cancel</Button>
    <Button>Confirm</Button>
  </CardFooter>
</Card>
```

```tsx
<div class="card-grid">
  <Card interactive>
    <CardContent>Option 1</CardContent>
  </Card>
  <Card interactive>
    <CardContent>Option 2</CardContent>
  </Card>
  <Card interactive>
    <CardContent>Option 3</CardContent>
  </Card>
</div>
```

---

### Checkbox
A checkbox input for boolean or indeterminate selections.

**Exports:** Checkbox

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Checkbox } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Checkbox />
```

```tsx
<Checkbox label="Accept terms and conditions" />
<Checkbox label="Subscribe to newsletter" />
```

```tsx
<Checkbox
  label="Email notifications"
  description="Receive email updates about your account activity"
/>
```

```tsx
const [checked, setChecked] = createSignal(false);

<Checkbox
  checked={checked()}
  onChange={() => setChecked(!checked())}
  label="Toggle me"
/>
```

```tsx
<Checkbox
  label="Select all"
  checked={allChecked()}
  indeterminate={someChecked()}
  onChange={toggleAll}
/>
```

```tsx
<Checkbox label="Disabled unchecked" disabled />
<Checkbox label="Disabled checked" disabled checked />
```

```tsx
const [selected, setSelected] = createSignal<string[]>([]);

const toggle = (value: string) => {
  setSelected(prev =>
    prev.includes(value)
      ? prev.filter(v => v !== value)
      : [...prev, value]
  );
};

<div class="stack-sm">
  <Checkbox
    label="Email notifications"
    checked={selected().includes("email")}
    onChange={() => toggle("email")}
  />
  <Checkbox
    label="SMS notifications"
    checked={selected().includes("sms")}
    onChange={() => toggle("sms")}
  />
  <Checkbox
    label="Push notifications"
    checked={selected().includes("push")}
    onChange={() => toggle("push")}
  />
</div>
```

```tsx
const items = ["Documents", "Images", "Videos", "Music"];
const [selected, setSelected] = createSignal<string[]>([]);

const allSelected = () => selected().length === items.length;
const someSelected = () => selected().length > 0 && !allSelected();

const toggleAll = () => {
  setSelected(allSelected() ? [] : [...items]);
};

const toggleItem = (item: string) => {
  setSelected(prev =>
    prev.includes(item)
      ? prev.filter(v => v !== item)
      : [...prev, item]
  );
};

<div class="stack-sm">
  <Checkbox
    label="Select all files"
    checked={allSelected()}
    indeterminate={someSelected()}
    onChange={toggleAll}
  />
  <div class="stack-sm" style={{ "margin-left": "1.5rem" }}>
    <For each={items}>
      {item => (
        <Checkbox
          label={item}
          checked={selected().includes(item)}
          onChange={() => toggleItem(item)}
        />
      )}
    </For>
  </div>
</div>
```

---

### Chevron
An animated chevron icon for expand/collapse indicators.

**Exports:** Chevron

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Chevron } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Chevron />
<Chevron expanded />
```

```tsx
<Chevron facing="right" />
<Chevron facing="down" />
```

```tsx
const [expanded, setExpanded] = createSignal(false);

<button onClick={() => setExpanded(e => !e)}>
  <Chevron expanded={expanded()} />
  Toggle
</button>
```

```tsx
<Chevron size="0.75em" />
<Chevron size="1em" />
<Chevron size="1.5em" />
<Chevron size={24} />
```

---

### Clamp
A text clamping component with expand/collapse functionality.

**Exports:** Clamp

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Clamp } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Clamp lines={3}>
  <p>Long text content that will be clamped after 3 lines...</p>
</Clamp>
```

```tsx
<Clamp lines={2}>
  <p>Clamped to 2 lines...</p>
</Clamp>

<Clamp lines={4}>
  <p>Clamped to 4 lines...</p>
</Clamp>
```

```tsx
<Clamp
  lines={2}
  showMoreText="Read more"
  showLessText="Read less"
>
  <p>Content with custom toggle labels...</p>
</Clamp>
```

---

### Collapsible
An expandable/collapsible content section with animated transitions.

**Exports:** Collapsible

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Collapsible } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Collapsible trigger="Click to expand">
  <p>Hidden content revealed on click.</p>
</Collapsible>
```

```tsx
<Collapsible trigger="Click me">
  <p>This content toggles when you click the trigger.</p>
</Collapsible>
```

```tsx
<Collapsible trigger="Already expanded" defaultOpen>
  <p>This is visible by default.</p>
</Collapsible>
```

```tsx
const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = createSignal(false);

<Collapsible 
  trigger="Controlled" 
  open={isOpen()} 
  onOpenChange={setIsOpen}
>
  <p>Controlled by external state.</p>
</Collapsible>
```

---

### Dropdown
A floating menu triggered by a button or element

**Exports:** Dropdown, DropdownTrigger, DropdownMenu, DropdownItem, DropdownDivider

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Dropdown, DropdownTrigger, DropdownMenu, DropdownItem, DropdownDivider } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Dropdown>
  <DropdownTrigger>
    <Button>Open Menu</Button>
  </DropdownTrigger>
  <DropdownMenu>
    <DropdownItem onClick={() => console.log("Edit")}>Edit</DropdownItem>
    <DropdownItem onClick={() => console.log("Duplicate")}>Duplicate</DropdownItem>
    <DropdownDivider />
    <DropdownItem onClick={() => console.log("Delete")}>Delete</DropdownItem>
  </DropdownMenu>
</Dropdown>
```

```tsx
<DropdownItem active={selected() === "Option 1"} onClick={() => setSelected("Option 1")}>
  Option 1
</DropdownItem>
```

```tsx
<DropdownMenu>
  <DropdownItem>
    <span>üìù</span> Edit
  </DropdownItem>
  <DropdownItem>
    <span>üìã</span> Copy
  </DropdownItem>
  <DropdownItem>
    <span>üóëÔ∏è</span> Delete
  </DropdownItem>
</DropdownMenu>
```

```tsx
<Dropdown>
  <DropdownTrigger>
    <Button>Actions</Button>
  </DropdownTrigger>
  <DropdownMenu>
    <DropdownItem onClick={handleEdit}>Edit</DropdownItem>
    <DropdownItem onClick={handleDuplicate}>Duplicate</DropdownItem>
    <DropdownItem onClick={handleArchive}>Archive</DropdownItem>
    <DropdownDivider />
    <DropdownItem onClick={handleDelete}>Delete</DropdownItem>
  </DropdownMenu>
</Dropdown>
```

```tsx
const [sort, setSort] = createSignal("date");

<Dropdown>
  <DropdownTrigger>
    <Button variant="secondary">Sort by: {sort()}</Button>
  </DropdownTrigger>
  <DropdownMenu>
    <DropdownItem active={sort() === "date"} onClick={() => setSort("date")}>
      Date
    </DropdownItem>
    <DropdownItem active={sort() === "name"} onClick={() => setSort("name")}>
      Name
    </DropdownItem>
    <DropdownItem active={sort() === "size"} onClick={() => setSort("size")}>
      Size
    </DropdownItem>
  </DropdownMenu>
</Dropdown>
```

```tsx
<Dropdown>
  <DropdownTrigger>
    <Button variant="ghost">
      <Avatar src={user.avatar} />
    </Button>
  </DropdownTrigger>
  <DropdownMenu>
    <DropdownItem onClick={() => navigate("/profile")}>Profile</DropdownItem>
    <DropdownItem onClick={() => navigate("/settings")}>Settings</DropdownItem>
    <DropdownDivider />
    <DropdownItem onClick={handleLogout}>Log out</DropdownItem>
  </DropdownMenu>
</Dropdown>
```

---

### Empty
A placeholder component for empty states with optional icon, message, and actions.

**Exports:** Empty

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Empty } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Empty
  title="No items found"
  description="Try adjusting your search or filters."
/>
```

```tsx
import { Empty, Button } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Empty
  title="No projects yet"
  description="Get started by creating your first project."
>
  <Button>Create Project</Button>
</Empty>
```

```tsx
import { Empty } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Empty
  icon={<InboxIcon />}
  title="Inbox is empty"
  description="You're all caught up!"
/>
```

---

### FormField
**Exports:** FormField

---

### Input
Form input components including text input, textarea, and select.

**Exports:** Input, Textarea, Select

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Input, Textarea, Select } from "@f0rbit/ui";
```

```tsx
<Input placeholder="Enter your name..." />
```

```tsx
<Input placeholder="Invalid input" error />
```

```tsx
<Input placeholder="Disabled" disabled />
```

```tsx
<Input type="password" placeholder="Password" />
```

```tsx
<Textarea placeholder="Enter your message..." />
```

```tsx
<Textarea placeholder="Invalid content" error />
```

```tsx
<Select>
  <option value="">Select an option</option>
  <option value="1">Option 1</option>
  <option value="2">Option 2</option>
  <option value="3">Option 3</option>
</Select>
```

```tsx
<Select error>
  <option value="">Selection required</option>
  <option value="1">Option 1</option>
</Select>
```

---

### Modal
A dialog overlay for focused user interactions

**Exports:** Modal, ModalHeader, ModalTitle, ModalBody, ModalFooter

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { createSignal } from "solid-js";
import { Modal, ModalHeader, ModalTitle, ModalBody, ModalFooter, Button } from "@f0rbit/ui";

const [open, setOpen] = createSignal(false);

<Button onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>Open Modal</Button>

<Modal open={open()} onClose={() => setOpen(false)}>
  <ModalHeader>
    <ModalTitle>Modal Title</ModalTitle>
  </ModalHeader>
  <ModalBody>
    Modal content goes here
  </ModalBody>
  <ModalFooter>
    <Button variant="secondary" onClick={() => setOpen(false)}>Cancel</Button>
    <Button onClick={() => setOpen(false)}>Confirm</Button>
  </ModalFooter>
</Modal>
```

```tsx
<Modal open={confirmOpen()} onClose={() => setConfirmOpen(false)}>
  <ModalHeader>
    <ModalTitle>Delete Item?</ModalTitle>
  </ModalHeader>
  <ModalBody>
    <p>This action cannot be undone.</p>
  </ModalBody>
  <ModalFooter>
    <Button variant="secondary" onClick={() => setConfirmOpen(false)}>
      Cancel
    </Button>
    <Button variant="danger" onClick={handleDelete}>
      Delete
    </Button>
  </ModalFooter>
</Modal>
```

```tsx
<Modal open={formOpen()} onClose={() => setFormOpen(false)}>
  <ModalHeader>
    <ModalTitle>Create New Item</ModalTitle>
  </ModalHeader>
  <ModalBody>
    <Input placeholder="Name" />
    <Textarea placeholder="Description" />
  </ModalBody>
  <ModalFooter>
    <Button variant="secondary" onClick={() => setFormOpen(false)}>
      Cancel
    </Button>
    <Button onClick={handleSubmit}>Create</Button>
  </ModalFooter>
</Modal>
```

```tsx
<Modal open={alertOpen()} onClose={() => setAlertOpen(false)}>
  <ModalBody>
    <p>Your changes have been saved.</p>
  </ModalBody>
  <ModalFooter>
    <Button onClick={() => setAlertOpen(false)}>OK</Button>
  </ModalFooter>
</Modal>
```

---

### Spinner
A loading indicator animation for async operations.

**Exports:** Spinner

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Spinner } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Spinner />
<Spinner size="sm" />
<Spinner size="lg" />
```

```tsx
<span style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center", gap: "0.5rem" }}>
  <Spinner size="sm" />
  Loading...
</span>
```

```tsx
const [loading, setLoading] = createSignal(false);

const handleSubmit = async () => {
  setLoading(true);
  await submitForm();
  setLoading(false);
};

<Button onClick={handleSubmit} disabled={loading()}>
  {loading() ? (
    <>
      <Spinner size="sm" />
      Saving...
    </>
  ) : (
    "Save changes"
  )}
</Button>
```

```tsx
<div class="cluster">
  <Button disabled={loading()}>
    {loading() ? <Spinner size="sm" /> : null}
    {loading() ? "Loading..." : "Submit"}
  </Button>
  <Button variant="secondary" disabled={loading()}>
    Cancel
  </Button>
</div>
```

```tsx
const PageLoader = () => (
  <div
    style={{
      display: "flex",
      "flex-direction": "column",
      "align-items": "center",
      "justify-content": "center",
      "min-height": "50vh",
      gap: "1rem",
    }}
  >
    <Spinner size="lg" />
    <p style={{ color: "var(--text-secondary)" }}>Loading your dashboard...</p>
  </div>
);

const Dashboard = () => {
  const [data] = createResource(fetchDashboardData);

  return (
    <Show when={!data.loading} fallback={<PageLoader />}>
      <DashboardContent data={data()} />
    </Show>
  );
};
```

```tsx
const FullScreenLoader = () => (
  <div
    style={{
      position: "fixed",
      inset: 0,
      display: "flex",
      "align-items": "center",
      "justify-content": "center",
      "background-color": "var(--bg-primary)",
      "z-index": 50,
    }}
  >
    <div class="stack" style={{ "align-items": "center" }}>
      <Spinner size="lg" />
      <p>Please wait...</p>
    </div>
  </div>
);
```

---

### Stat
A display component for statistics with value and label.

**Exports:** Stat

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Stat } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Stat value={42} label="Total Users" />
```

```tsx
<Stat value={1234} label="Total Users" />
<Stat value={99.9} label="Success Rate" />
```

```tsx
<Stat value="99.9%" label="Uptime" />
<Stat value="$12,345" label="Revenue" />
<Stat value="1.2M" label="Downloads" />
```

```tsx
<div class="stats-grid">
  <Stat value={42} label="Active Projects" />
  <Stat value={128} label="Team Members" />
  <Stat value="2.5k" label="Commits" />
  <Stat value="99%" label="Test Coverage" />
</div>
```

```tsx
const TrendStat = (props: {
  value: string | number;
  label: string;
  change: number;
}) => {
  const isPositive = () => props.change >= 0;

  return (
    <div class="stack-xs">
      <Stat value={props.value} label={props.label} />
      <span
        style={{
          color: isPositive() ? "var(--color-success)" : "var(--color-danger)",
          "font-size": "0.875rem",
          display: "flex",
          "align-items": "center",
          gap: "0.25rem",
        }}
      >
        <Chevron direction={isPositive() ? "up" : "down"} size={12} />
        {Math.abs(props.change)}%
      </span>
    </div>
  );
};

<div class="stats-grid">
  <TrendStat value="$48,352" label="Revenue" change={12.5} />
  <TrendStat value="2,847" label="Orders" change={8.2} />
  <TrendStat value="1.2k" label="Returns" change={-3.1} />
  <TrendStat value="4.8" label="Rating" change={0.3} />
</div>
```

```tsx
const ComparisonStat = (props: {
  value: string | number;
  label: string;
  previousValue: string | number;
  previousLabel: string;
}) => (
  <div class="stack-xs">
    <Stat value={props.value} label={props.label} />
    <span style={{ color: "var(--text-secondary)", "font-size": "0.75rem" }}>
      vs {props.previousValue} {props.previousLabel}
    </span>
  </div>
);

<div class="stats-grid">
  <ComparisonStat
    value="1,234"
    label="Users this month"
    previousValue="987"
    previousLabel="last month"
  />
  <ComparisonStat
    value="$52k"
    label="Revenue this quarter"
    previousValue="$41k"
    previousLabel="last quarter"
  />
  <ComparisonStat
    value="89%"
    label="Satisfaction rate"
    previousValue="84%"
    previousLabel="last survey"
  />
</div>
```

---

### Status
A status indicator with colored dot and label for displaying state.

**Exports:** Status

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Status } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Status state="active" />
```

```tsx
<Status state="active" />   {/* Green */}
<Status state="inactive" /> {/* Gray */}
<Status state="error" />    {/* Red */}
<Status state="pending" />  {/* Yellow */}
```

```tsx
<Status state="active" label="Online" />
<Status state="inactive" label="Offline" />
<Status state="error" label="Failed" />
<Status state="pending" label="Processing" />
```

```tsx
<div>
  <span>API Server</span>
  <Status state="active" label="Healthy" />
</div>
<div>
  <span>Database</span>
  <Status state="pending" label="Connecting" />
</div>
<div>
  <span>Cache</span>
  <Status state="error" label="Down" />
</div>
```

---

### Stepper
A multi-step progress indicator for wizards and multi-step forms.

**Exports:** Step, Stepper

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Stepper, Step } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Stepper>
  <Step title="Step 1" status="completed" />
  <Step title="Step 2" status="current" />
  <Step title="Step 3" status="upcoming" />
</Stepper>
```

```tsx
<Stepper>
  <Step title="Account" description="Create your account" status="completed" />
  <Step title="Profile" description="Set up your profile" status="current" />
  <Step title="Review" description="Review and submit" status="upcoming" />
</Stepper>
```

```tsx
<Stepper orientation="vertical">
  <Step title="Order placed" status="completed" />
  <Step title="Processing" status="completed" />
  <Step title="Shipping" status="current" />
  <Step title="Delivered" status="upcoming" />
</Stepper>
```

```tsx
<Stepper orientation="vertical">
  <Step title="Select plan" status="completed">
    <p>You selected the Pro plan at $19/month.</p>
  </Step>
  <Step title="Payment details" status="current">
    <form>
      <input type="text" placeholder="Card number" class="input" />
      <button type="submit" class="btn">Continue</button>
    </form>
  </Step>
  <Step title="Confirmation" status="upcoming" />
</Stepper>
```

---

### Tabs
A tabbed interface for organizing content into separate views.

**Exports:** MyTabs, Tabs, TabList, Tab, TabPanel

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Tabs, TabList, Tab, TabPanel } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Tabs defaultValue="overview">
  <TabList>
    <Tab value="overview">Overview</Tab>
    <Tab value="features">Features</Tab>
  </TabList>
  <TabPanel value="overview">
    <p>Overview content here.</p>
  </TabPanel>
  <TabPanel value="features">
    <p>Features content here.</p>
  </TabPanel>
</Tabs>
```

```tsx
<Tabs defaultValue="first">
  <TabList>
    <Tab value="first">First</Tab>
    <Tab value="second">Second</Tab>
  </TabList>
  <TabPanel value="first">First panel content</TabPanel>
  <TabPanel value="second">Second panel content</TabPanel>
</Tabs>
```

```tsx
const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = createSignal("tab1");

<Tabs value={activeTab()} onValueChange={setActiveTab}>
  <TabList>
    <Tab value="tab1">Tab 1</Tab>
    <Tab value="tab2">Tab 2</Tab>
  </TabList>
  <TabPanel value="tab1">Controlled content 1</TabPanel>
  <TabPanel value="tab2">Controlled content 2</TabPanel>
</Tabs>
```

---

### Timeline
A vertical timeline for displaying chronological events.

**Exports:** Timeline

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Timeline, type TimelineItem } from "@f0rbit/ui";

const items: TimelineItem[] = [
  { id: 1, title: "Order placed", timestamp: "10:30 AM" },
  { id: 2, title: "Processing", timestamp: "10:45 AM" },
  { id: 3, title: "Shipped", timestamp: "2:15 PM" },
];

<Timeline items={items} />
```

```tsx
const items: TimelineItem[] = [
  {
    id: 1,
    title: "Pull request opened",
    description: "feat: add new authentication flow",
    timestamp: "2 hours ago",
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    title: "Code review completed",
    description: "Approved by 2 reviewers",
    timestamp: "1 hour ago",
  },
];

<Timeline items={items} />
```

```tsx
const items: TimelineItem[] = [
  { id: 1, title: "Build started", variant: "info", timestamp: "10:00 AM" },
  { id: 2, title: "Tests passed", variant: "success", timestamp: "10:05 AM" },
  { id: 3, title: "Linting warnings", variant: "warning", timestamp: "10:06 AM" },
  { id: 4, title: "Deployment failed", variant: "error", timestamp: "10:10 AM" },
];

<Timeline items={items} />
```

```tsx
const items: TimelineItem[] = [
  { id: 1, title: "Completed", icon: <CheckIcon />, variant: "success" },
  { id: 2, title: "Pending", icon: <AlertIcon />, variant: "warning" },
];

<Timeline items={items} />
```

```tsx
interface TimelineItem {
  id: string | number;
  title: string;
  description?: string;
  timestamp?: string;
  icon?: JSX.Element;
  variant?: "default" | "success" | "error" | "warning" | "info";
}
```

---

### Toggle
A switch component for toggling between on/off states.

**Exports:** Toggle

**Examples:**

```tsx
import { Toggle } from "@f0rbit/ui";

<Toggle />
```

```tsx
<Toggle label="Dark mode" />
<Toggle label="Auto-save" checked />
```

```tsx
<Toggle
  label="Push notifications"
  description="Receive alerts when someone mentions you"
/>
<Toggle
  label="Two-factor authentication"
  description="Add an extra layer of security to your account"
  checked
/>
```

```tsx
const [enabled, setEnabled] = createSignal(false);

<Toggle
  checked={enabled()}
  onChange={() => setEnabled(!enabled())}
  label="Enable feature"
/>
```

```tsx
<Toggle label="Default size" />
<Toggle label="Small size" size="sm" />
```

```tsx
<Toggle label="Disabled off" disabled />
<Toggle label="Disabled on" disabled checked />
```

```tsx
const [settings, setSettings] = createSignal({
  darkMode: true,
  notifications: true,
  emailDigest: false,
  twoFactor: true,
  analytics: false,
});

const updateSetting = (key: keyof typeof settings) => {
  setSettings(prev => ({ ...prev, [key]: !prev[key] }));
};

<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Preferences</CardTitle>
    <CardDescription>Manage your account settings</CardDescription>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>
    <div class="stack">
      <div class="setting-row">
        <Toggle
          label="Dark mode"
          description="Use dark theme across the application"
          checked={settings().darkMode}
          onChange={() => updateSetting("darkMode")}
        />
      </div>
      <div class="setting-row">
        <Toggle
          label="Push notifications"
          description="Receive alerts for important updates"
          checked={settings().notifications}
          onChange={() => updateSetting("notifications")}
        />
      </div>
      <div class="setting-row">
        <Toggle
          label="Weekly email digest"
          description="Get a summary of activity every Monday"
          checked={settings().emailDigest}
          onChange={() => updateSetting("emailDigest")}
        />
      </div>
    </div>
  </CardContent>
</Card>

<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Security</CardTitle>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>
    <div class="stack">
      <Toggle
        label="Two-factor authentication"
        description="Require a code when signing in"
        checked={settings().twoFactor}
        onChange={() => updateSetting("twoFactor")}
      />
      <Toggle
        label="Usage analytics"
        description="Help improve the product by sharing anonymous usage data"
        checked={settings().analytics}
        onChange={() => updateSetting("analytics")}
      />
    </div>
  </CardContent>
</Card>
```

---

## CSS Tokens

The library uses CSS custom properties for theming. Key tokens:

- `--bg`, `--bg-alt` - Background colors
- `--fg`, `--fg-muted`, `--fg-subtle`, `--fg-faint` - Text colors  
- `--accent`, `--accent-fg` - Accent/primary colors
- `--border` - Border color
- `--radius`, `--radius-lg` - Border radius
- `--space-xs`, `--space-sm`, `--space-md`, `--space-lg`, `--space-xl` - Spacing
- `--text-xs`, `--text-sm`, `--text-base`, `--text-lg`, `--text-xl` - Font sizes

## Utility Classes

- `.stack`, `.stack-sm`, `.stack-lg` - Vertical flex layouts
- `.row`, `.row-sm`, `.row-lg` - Horizontal flex layouts  
- `.grid`, `.grid-2`, `.grid-3`, `.grid-4` - Grid layouts
- `.text-primary`, `.text-muted`, `.text-subtle`, `.text-faint` - Text colors
- `.truncate`, `.sr-only`, `.hidden` - Utilities

## Links

- Documentation: https://f0rbit.github.io/ui
- Repository: https://github.com/f0rbit/ui.git
